required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Balance Training by BBS on Gait Parameters and Balance in Patients With RLAS
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Balance Training by Biodex Balance System on Gait Parameters and Balance in Patients With RLAS

brief_summary.textblock: This study will be conducted to find out the effect of adding balance training on gait parameters, balance, and Sensory Interaction

detailed_description.textblock: LAS are not benign injuries. As many as 4 in 10 individuals will develop chronic ankle instability (CAI) after a first-time sprain, More than half of patients with osteoarthritis (OA) of the ankle report a history of a sport-related ankle injury, and 85% of those are LAS.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Fifty subjects (power analysis) of both gender diagnosed with recurrent lateral ankle sprain patients will be assigned randomly into 2 groups. Group (A) will receive biodex balance training Group (B)will receive a physical therapy exercise protocol only

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Treatment and after 6 weeks of treatment
primary_outcome.description: Change in Cadence measurements using Walkway Gait System.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Treatment and after 6 weeks of treatment
primary_outcome.description: Change in Gait time measurements using Walkway Gait System.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Treatment and after 6 weeks of treatment
primary_outcome.description: Change in Clinical Sensory Integration test measurements using Biodex balance System.

arm_group.description: Group (A) twenty-five patients will receive biodex balance training
twenty-five patients will receive a physical therapy exercise protocol

intervention.description: Subjects will receive several unique training modules using biodex
Subjects will receive recommended PT program

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The patient will be referred to the outpatient clinic of the orthopedic department, Faculty of physical therapy, MTI University. with a confirmed diagnosis of recurrent Lateral ankle sprain grade II
- Subjects will be excluded if they had one of the following criteria:
Previous musculoskeletal injury to the lower limb or lumbar spine including a fracture, a sprain, or an unstable joint other than the injured ankle.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Demonstrator at Department of musculoskeletal disorders and it's surgeries
